_SkzV088RqWXKCdYUWE2QQ.text: As a P&P Myers Park regular, had always wondered why they didn't make sandwich's so...Voila! The Park Road outlet now does and it's not a bad sandwich to boot. Got the Italian (being a devoted Philly Italian Hoagie guy) and it hit all the right notes (the exception being the smaller, square shaped roll- good quality bread but the ingredients overwhelmed the roll) sharp provolone, Italian cold cuts and a pretty good basil aioli. Add on hot peppers and a sweet pepper relish and it's a pretty darn good $7.95 sandwich. Well done!

ZKomDcDSj87_QPinbsnp5Q.text: Awesome! The patio space so nice on warm days. Food is on point, great to sit down and eat out take it to go. Everyone that works there is extremely friendly.

NXNdSXf6uwC5j_Xwz49otA.text: It's pretty sad when the new location is right across the street from my work and because of the employees I will drive out of my way to go to the providence road location. I went in looking for recommendations for different sauce and pasta combinations and one employee gave me nothing but sarcasm and attitude when I asked about different sauces available. Then acted as if I was crazy for asking a question as if his personal conversation with another employee was much more important. Such a sad start to a new location

Hid_4ji1Kwth6L_96OEWiQ.text: after several visits in less than a week, i figured it was time to let you know the deal-it is AWESOME! i had the 5-topping pizza (you get to select them from the list that the guy keeps in his head) which costs $10 . the thin and crispy crust is a perfect compliment to the flavor of the sauce (robust, but not overpowering). i chose pepperoni, sausage, onions, meatball, and black olives. after just a few minutes the pizza was out of the oven and on its way to my gut. the pizza was among the best i have ever eaten-and i have eaten tons of pizza from new york to ecuador. i decided to dine in so i added a bottle of gold peak tea.there was a selection of sparkling waters and other beverages. the wooden counters allow you to look out upon park road and think about how good the pizza is. i mean, seriously... this was outstanding. two times in a row. the cook is friendly, but a bit reserved. but, i don't want him to do cartwheels. i want him to keep churning out that delicious pizza.the other guy at the register was very thankful for my visit(s) . they also have a wine selection and fresh pasta to go if you are enough of a sucker to try to math their skills. if you haven't tried this joint do so TODAY.

XQ40thGJHgnaLsSgSB0NVQ.text: We go here about twice a month and everything is great - we typically get the fresh pasta with sauce a but have ventured into the chicken parm, raviolis, etc.  Great way to make a romantic meal at home ready made in 30 min. The game changer is the Philly cheesesteak off the sand which menu - pick that up and carry it over to Brawley's next door for a pint and have yourself a nice little afternoon.

QItwRm05ADTcle7zICMuyQ.text: Our first time here. What a great experience. Bought a pound of basil fettuccine to bring home for dinner. So excited. Everyone was super nice.

Myl08qi3ViAEt0Ie6o9-Pg.text: Amidst the chaos of Park Road and Charlotte in general you can have an amazing meal and relax with a glass of wine or beer. The patio is awesome.

LSw12Vs-2bV7cYUgfc17pQ.text: Stopped here with my Fiance because we were craving pasta. I got garlic pasta with meatballs and he got pesto pasta with chicken. Both dishes tasted great and we will definitely be back again. I liked the fact that the pasta seemed home made and fresh! The bread was okay, but totally loved the rest of it. I would try this place out if you get the chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garlic Pesto Pasta with Chicken.
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garlic Marinara Pasta with Meatballs.

zKFfVuHeSkbWh_4A7EJ7xQ.text: I absolutely love this place. Not fancy at all. Don't let the looks deceive you. The best noodles I've EVER had. You don't pay for the presentation, waiters with long wait aprons nor the decor. You pay for good food.  You can order from their menu and they call your name when your order is ready. Limited seating inside but I was told they do have a nice patio in warmer weather.  Beer and wine is available. They also have a nice olive oil for sell, a decent wine selection, and homemade frozen food selection.

N8ASx3Q-H0jmzU3Ue-3mFw.text: Got the Caprese sandwhich - fresh ingredients and amazing bread! Great patio and beverage selection

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Caprese sandwich killer bread, fresh delish! Great beer and soda choices! And the patio!!

DaTAJWvstUYNy5PU08y-6g.text: This place is the best. Incredible food, homemade fresh pasta, excellent Italian high end groceries, fun area to eat outside, super friendly staff. Just awesome!

Jz5JQ9Ob4vnlo1oXq98UmA.text: Went for lunch today.  Food came out quickly, and I must say, some of the best pasta I've ever had.  Although, I will say that I blame them for my after lunch food coma....totally worth it!

T0FfjEZ49qRWpYZnR17ixw.text: So glad this gem came to our neighborhood! The food is amazing. We are particularly fond of the pizzas and the amazing staff. In the summer we love the King of Pops freezer and enjoying those Popsicles on the patio. The beer on tap is great and the wine selection is wonderful. There are also grocery items that we haven't found since our trip to Italy that we can now keep in rotation. Stop by when you can. You won't be disappointed.

0lRrElEV1AvbUvfTXxES4Q.text: Absolutely have nothing bad to say about this place!!!! Amazing!!! Food is always on point!!! Now I can never go back to box paste again!!! Thank you so much for amazing food and outstanding customer service!!! We will be back for sure!!!

TqA8Ju9JuO_NguF9IpNnmQ.text: We went for our first time tonight and the food was delicious. One thing that made this menu great was that you could mix and match - for example, my husband and I both got ravioli but I had cheese ravioli with pomodoro sauce and he had chicken ravioli with pesto. We both got added veggies. It was all super fresh and the staff was friendly and quick. When we asked what veggies they had they told us bell peppers and onions. After they started making our food, one of the guys came out and said they realized they also had artichoke hearts if we wanted to add those in which I appreciated the offer. Also big bonus in my book - they had reusable glasses for the water and proper silverware. I love it when restaurants don't run around disposables because they are so wasteful so it was refreshing to see this! They have a great little shop too with pasta that looked amazing. We got a back to take home for later. The food was delicious, the service was quick and friendly, and the price was pretty reasonable! We will definitely be back to try other things!

9uOyWnKyfGjX_7z5m2zF8g.text: Great Italian provisions , healthy yet tasty lunch options, and ALWAYS playing awesome music.

Ytjqxxz7Q98buph4pmYafA.text: Great atmosphere for a casual lunch or a warm evening dinner on the patio. Very inter menu with a variety of options. Cool ambiance and reasonable price.

rJNc5MtXcsVrxn2vi6iNAA.text: Great staff, great food, perfect location. We've eaten in and carried out (sandwiches, pasta, salads) and all have been delicious. One minor annoyance; they now charge a $5 "corking fee" for wine consumed on premise. I understand on/off premise pricing disparity but the fee seems trifling in a self-service joint. Maybe I'm just old and cranky....Go get some; you won't be sorry.

4vJc_mjouApYpje-0PjbNg.text: Walked in for the first time ever based on word of mouth. Bought rosemary pasta and meatsauce.  All of it fresh. Took it home, reheated it and within 15min we had an amazing dish. Most delicious fresh pasta i've ever had. Worth every penny.

WfzfLPSHEU906PUi8gRP7A.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte! The pasta is obviously out of this world. Other gems include gorg/artichoke spread, chicken lasagna, and pomodoro sauce. The Philly cheesesteak is not technically on the menu but it's amazing, just ask for it. The list goes on, Tuscan kale salad and all pizzas are phenom. Customer service is on point and they always play good music. Look for the garden terrace to the left and grab a beer or glass of wine while you eat. Eat pasta run fasta!

BtGu4aC-l5ciG-OVax3GSw.text: This is one of my favorite places on planet Earth. Amazing food. Great food and wine shopping options. And AMAZINGLY friendly and helpful staff.

gxyMfTfdhdtNenBbPx5UcA.text: So impressed. Fast fresh pasta and salads and sandwiches. Eat in or on patio or to go. What a slam dunk good place. Nothing quite like it. Not a lot of room to eat in , mainly a take out / to go deal. But man is it the right type of place for great pick up on park Rd. All pastas and sauces and such are house made. Nothing from the big food companies delivered in. Check it out for sure.

f24apWPDEImHGBkiDecXkw.text: Finding establishments that are good with food allergies is not always easy. Recently one of our PAK members said "Pasta and Provisions on Park are very attentive to accommodating to food allergies."

EsGV7crvl8vaku7E0lpeQg.text: Fantastic fresh pasta, they have sandwiches too, little side items to go, very friendly staff and quick. Perfect choice for a homemade-ish meal and across the street from Brawley's!

JpjZYnTOxsbnkZEh-LyDHg.text: Fresh fresh fresh, ravioli with pamadoro sauce incredible, perfectly spiced. Must eat more pasta!! Beautiful and tasty slice of provo and prosciutto

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pasta Time!!

hAofOFXGj_J0LidzPwTGZA.text: This place is amazing!! We get almost the same thing everytime and love it. Their bolognese is so good, especially paired with their fresh cut homemade pasta. We have tried the salt & pepper, and garlic flavored ones and we love them! We stop in and get them, along with the fresh grated parmesan and make it at home. The sauce just has to be reheated and the pasta takes less than a minute to boil. We have also tried the Spinach ravioli which was great too! Love this place and highly recommend!

uk9qQ7Mq7PUxmqyjnYHvVg.text: This place is like magic you didn't know that you needed in your life. We have passed this place before and didn't even know they sold food until we yelped it and said let's try it. So glad we did. It's a cute and cozy place and the staff was wonderful and helpful with all of my questions.  After we ordered we went outside and it got even better it was so relaxing to sit outside and enjoy your meal here. If you haven't checked them out please do they won't disappoint at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States

tE_GiH_3ygkwCB0BPIBplw.text: Reasonably priced pasta made fresh and dishes that are customizable...what more can you ask for?  This was my first time visiting after hearing a lot of buzz about it from my coworkers.  I was craving shrimp scampi (they do not sale this dish) but, the roasted garlic noodles with pomodoro sauce was pretty delish.  My pasta was delicious but, the fresh tomatoes in the sauce was the main attraction for me.  The staff was super nice and patient and the food was ready pretty quickly.  They also have a great list of sandwiches and prepared meals to go.  I will definitely be back again to explore this menu and think up some cool combinations and meals.

zPDinSSiqrC06IkbIhRweA.text: I haven't eaten in yet, but I've take away a few items from the grocery portion.  The ravioli was filled to capacity with fresh, flavorful ingredients. The sauces we tried - pomodoro and the creamy gorgonzola - were yummy.  The tomato was much better, the gorgonzola a bit over salted for my taste and perhaps not enough pungent gorgonzola flavor (needs just a touch more).  Look forward to returning for an in house made pizza or pasta dish for sure!

LUKkqA5TvvA9NsGRaKRkUQ.text: I stopped by here on Mother's Day for a lunch.  I had been wanting to try it for some time.  I had the meatball sub which was delicious.  The meatballs tasted so good!!!  The bread had a little bit of a burnt taste, but I'm not sure why.  The meatballs made up for it.  The pasta I tried was garlic parm flavor with marinara.  The noodles were a little hard & chewy, perhaps just a few more minutes cooked or even one more would have been better.  I love an al dente pasta, and I know what al dente is, but this just wasn't there yet. The wine by the glass is very tiny, but cute.  The patio was amazing!! I don't know if you can buy bottles here & drink them, but something I'd love to do.  The staff was friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States

HRQecLyrKFDvSx1LF6A5wg.text: Wanted to a try a new spot and was impressed! I had caprese sandwich and kale salad, husband had cheesesteak and Cobb salad- so good! Very economical and delicious!

ycpYMIj1DXy97azMJfK7fA.text: The ambience is great. The patio couldn't be cuter and the market is nice. But gotta be honest... actually don't think their pasta is very good

Fxx2UIu8Kp-54GKW89Kdtg.text: This place is freaking awesome! Such a good vibe and super family friendly! Charlotte is better for p and p being around!

bv0kJXXcDsCEai1IohoTNg.text: First timers and we were very satisfied. Customer service was top notch! My 10 yr old twins loved the pasta and butter with shaved carrots. Hard to please! Look forward to becoming a regular. I had the Kalmata olives and they were fresh and more than enough!

Y2ey2V72QEMB5YtTWJ9j1w.text: Their sandwiches are so delicious! I had one of the best veggie sandwiches there I ever had in my life! There is a cute outdoor seating area and limited window seating inside. They have a good sized parking lot and is easy to get in and out of.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie sandwhich

tGkrOufMBK1vbYz05AmfYQ.text: Went for lunch on a Saturday for first time and was pleasantly surprised. Daughter had sandwich and I had fresh garlic pasta with marinara and everythign was delicious and tasted very fresh. We had to buy one of their fresh baked cakes which was really good as well. Will come back for sure. Staff was very nice as well

WDpzJLMrZ9SM99-vKnRRnw.text: This place is fantastic! Food is great and the customer service is even better. Every time my husband and I go in there everybody working in there is awesomely nice!!! They have wine, beer and plenty of options in the freezer for meals to take home for the nights you don't feel like cooking. The patio is awesome too. I highly recommend this place.

AwgruORf-029qzDXaIs78g.text: There's a lot of 5-star here... the pasta is AMAZING. I recommend the arugula pepper or the garlic parsley. You can definitely recommend this place on pasta alone, but the sauce is great too. Pomodoro is legit 5-stars. It's also a cool night spot with dinner, wine, & beer. They're right across the street from Brawley's, but this is the place to be, with a hidden patio area. The people that work here are also some of the nicest folks you'll meet. Good people & good pasta. Who can ask for more?

772VUL_nqJk1Ba-n1G6tmA.text: I love the pasta here. The food is amazing. I only give this 2 stars for the simple fact that I am a Vegan and every time I come here I get an attitude from the cook. I ask for a compromise for them to add veggies to my pasta. I continually get the same remarks and facial expressions. Not good at all. I questioned the cook as to why there is a problem with me requesting veggies on my pasta. His BS response was that he wants people to taste the pasta. I'm like don't they add meatballs or chicken... As you can see that convo went no where.   I really try to support local businesses but this was a fail.  I really hope their attitude about this changes. FYI: I even asked them to charge me for a meat to add the veggies.

PXs0eQHsILCTv2zMJnOo8w.text: Friendly staff. All the food is delicuous (meatball sub, philly cheese steak sub, cheese ravioli) Good beer selection of a few drafts and local cans. Relaxng outside seating Lots of refrigerated/frozen dishes to take home. New to south park area, this is our new lunch staple.

rRoeisHu1EMwGUmluobLew.text: Okay, so I'm totally violating my rule of not reviewing a place until after I go there multiple times, but come on, how can this place get any better? Driving back from errands one night, The Lady requests that I pick up Pasta Primavera from Portofinos. Fine choice, but I want something a little bit different. Decide that it would be a perfect opportunity to stop right up the road and check out Pasta & Provisions.  First off, it's a pretty full Italian market. They have a dry-goods section, a deli, and fridges/freezers for all wet things. Most of it is imported, which is super cool. I got super lucky, and their daily special was pretty much a pasta primavera (score) for $7, and I ordered the turkey sandwich for myself, $7 again. The first thing I noticed was that the cooks were cooking with skillets right there in front of me, how much fresher food could you make? Everything was done to-order and fresh, and the taste really reflected that.  I overheard a family order a couple of cannolis, which I missed upon first glance of the menu. True to italian style, the cannolis are filled to-order and dipped in either chocolate chips or pistachios. I didn't really have a difficult decision to make, I'll take 2 small ones (for $1.25 each!) Absolutely delicious.  They have a killer patio out back as well where lots of families were hanging out, plus they do have taps, so you can hang out for a while! We'll be hitting up this place a lot more now that we know about the incredible gem it is. Buon appetito!

1j3Ezm_JBjTxYaQHfXADTw.text: Thank You for a wonderful Valentines Day Dinner!!  This was my first experience with your take home dinners!  Wow!  What a tasty meal that was, "I pretended that I worked hard" but I did give you all of the credit!!  Will return soon!!

7vNZXf6Zde0v-GneI5eNUw.text: An all around great spot! Super friendly staff, great food that you can either eat in or take out. They have the absolute best fettuccine Alfredo I have ever tasted.

s1DQw10WVlEMqvwH9FRk-w.text: We stopped in here for a quick lunch and were definitely not disappointed! I had the garlic pasta with pesto, and my boyfriend had the chicken ravioli with the tomato sauce. Both were phenomenal. Their sandwiches also looked awesome. We ate out on the patio and it was beautiful, and there was even a dog visiting for lunch with its person. Everything was very fresh and delicious. We will be back!

wjhnfw4CdmO2w1K9m44Cww.text: I got sad (like Sunday afternoon sad when you realize tomorrow's Monday) when I was 2 bites away from finishing my Gnocchi Black Pepper Ricotta, with the marinara meatballs.  WHOA! Honestly, there is so much mediocre food out there and Pasta & Provisions is an amazing million steps above the norm.  This is my second time there - was first impressed by the meatballs and also the pepper linguini.  I also cannot wait to try the chicken ravioli - that's tomorrow night!!!  5 stars all day long!!!

VvtzkmTeCgbEppyws1C-Kg.text: This place is perfection.  You can order between different pasta/meat options, a sandwich, or get meats and pasta options to cook at home.  This place is so cute on the inside and has a surprisingly cozy patio out back.  You order at the front, get a buzzer, and sit where you would like.  We ordered the fettuccine with mushroom flavored noodles, Alfredo sauce, and chicken.  We also ordered the spinach ravioli with pesto add Parmesan.  Wine is reasonably priced and there is self-serve water dispenser, along with Parmesan cheese, red pepper flakes, and oregano to take to your table.  I love this extra touch.  Our buzzer went off after about 7 minutes. Each pasta dish was in a bowl and both were so delicious.   They each came with a piece of bread.  Please let my pictures do the talking.... we will definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach ravioli with pesto sauce add Parmesan
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fettuccine with Alfredo sauce and mushroom flavored noodles
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cozy patio

-YhcPoS_XrwIphyrh69OkQ.text: The Deli. Oh, the Deli!  I had just finished a beer at Brawley's across the street and knew we needed dinner, so I walked over. My husband ordered the meatball sub, and I tried the pork belly sandwich. The staff was very kind and helpful with their recommendations. Both sandwiches were excellent! (I liked my pork belly the best!) The egg and arugula were the perfect compliments to the perfectly cooked pork belly.  This place is also home to a ton of homemade pasta and sauces there for take home. I have only done this once, but I would like to do it more.   I even checked out the patio out back, which is a hidden gem. They have made a lovely space with hanging lanterns, etc out back that is an awesome place to enjoy a sandwich or any beer off their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork belly sandwich with arugula, red onion, and a fried egg
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meatball sub
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice little hidden patio

lsF5TCba3KnIFt2tqY42DA.text: If you know what to expect, this place cannot be beat.  There is not a lot of seating, only a bar facing a window while we were there, but arriving at 11:15 on a Friday was perfect.  My wife and I split a caprese pizza and the Italian sandwich.  WOW!  We were blown away.  The pizza's thin crust was nice and crispy.  We had ample mozzarella and delicious balsamic vinegar.  There was so much flavor.  We even added pancetta.  The sandwich was amazing too.  Plenty of filling and everything worked very well together.  We left stuffed and very happy.  I even bought tiramisu from the freezer for later.  The total bill for everything, including the desert and tip, was ~$40, but it was worth it.  One person could eat very well here for $15.  Since it is about a mile from my office, I will be back often!  Great spot!

FZ_NfOb_lwhJFXYfIV7t6A.text: You can shop here for fresh pasta and related groceries like cheese, olives and sauce as well as eat some food in the outdoor patio(very cute and cozy) There is a small bar table inside as well. I ordered spaghetti with meatball on pomodoro sauce. I liked the tender and springy texture of handmade spaghetti and beef and pork mixed meatball was great with pomodoro sauce. Also all staffs were very kind to answer your all question. Definitely will try different pasta next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States

XacOWFoga8WBi888y9Ma-A.text: I love the take and make food (pasta, sauces and more) But they also have made to order food like sandwiches, pizza and salads!!!  So delicious. Also excited to visit the new Wilmore store.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States

y5aNUbknomi8YJcJWrgJGw.text: This place is quite literally amazing! A total CLT staple. They offer a variety of pasta flavors and sauces made in house alongside their selection of pizza and sandwiches--all absolutely delicious. Would heavily recommend the fettuccini Alfredo on roasted garlic pasta!! The pizzas are thin crust with an indulgent portion of fresh mozzarella. The wine selection is both affordable and comprehensive in taste. In addition to all this, P&P offers a gigantic, varied selection of take-home frozen and refrigerated pasta dishes (I'm talking goat cheese, sweet potato ravioli, baked ziti, you name it)! They do allow dogs outside on the patio and the managers were super friendly to us and our baby boy! 5/5 would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States

X77wXHVOsiQHDgkHdIeUBw.text: Amazing. Love the variety of bake dishes, pasta and sauces. They also offer fresh balsamic, vinegar, fresh sliced deli meats and bread. Love that they also offer Lenny boy kombucha. Haven't been able to sit in and order to eat yet but definitely will be back. Tiramisu was huge! Only downside was we went on a Sunday and they were stocked low on many things we wanted after making the trip there. Hope next time they will have prepared for the busy weekend.

1F7NPnW5e7G-X3iyVgnuBA.text: Freshest pasta in Charlotte. I'm working my way through the different flavors now - started with the ravioli, then the egg spaghetti with marinara and so on, most recently the black pepper with pomodoro and meatballs -  and all taste so good you sort of just want to eat the pasta by itself. I adore pasta so I can't get away from that menu but my husband speaks highly of the sandwiches too. The patio is fun in the afternoon with a lot of people drinking beer and enjoying time outside with friends, kids, dogs...  Only complaints I have had: sometimes the pasta isn't well drained so there's a half-cup of water at the bottom of the bowl, and having ice available for drinks would be appreciated since not all of us are beer drinkers.   Take home a loaf of bread for later and if you like olives? Theirs are super delicious.

-MG2DAVf1Q8NQaZYrwJ3Lw.text: Cheesesteak was delicious! They have a great variety of craft beers to choose from as well as the option to try their Kombucha. They also have nice options for pasta to go and the food I ordered was delicious!! I would highly recommend checking this local spot out. I plan to come back and order pasta to cook at home as well as have a beer while I wait. Great price and food -bravo P&P!!

Pz8nPMTWFW_YwTpeMnjCDQ.text: I love coming here to order fresh pasta to go! It's fantastic!   The taste is incredible and I love that you can freeze it or use it within 3 days of being in the fridge. It's so much faster than making it myself.    I had the pizza and pasta ordered in and sat outside. The outside area was quaint. The cheese pizza was pretty good, but I thought the fettuccini Alfredo was terrible.   My friend was so nice she traded with me. So I was happy with the pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yum.. Now i have individual fettuccini for the whole week! Yay!

zcj_q9WtZUskDr9jICDd4A.text: I'm a lover of bolognese. Anytime I get Italian food, it's typically the same order: Caesar salad and bolognese pasta and bread. Wish this place had that. Maybe I just didn't see it.   It's my dudes birthday and his fave food is Italian. Being the good wife that I am I decided to bring Italy to him.   The dudes at the store today were extremely helpful. They told me about the deal where you can get fresh pasta, a container of sauce, a bag of salad, and bread, all for $20! That's what's up! And I dont even have to tip AND I'll have leftovers! That's what's up!   I got the rosemary pasta, pomodoro sauce with meatballs, herb foccacio bread, and decided to get a bottle of red wine.   The food was AWESOME SAUCE! Literally. The sauce was seasoned well and the meatballs were tender. The pasta itself was so fresh and tasty.   I'd definitely go back. Maybe for some hot food next time.

W-M6xeXf05n0divQFRMK1Q.text: This is everything the world needs: pasta, pizza, beer, wine, and a great patio! This takes me back to my travels in Italy with shelves stocked with imported pastas and olive oils. They even carry Abbracci Cookies!  The food they have on their daily menu is simple, but fresh and delicious. They have pastas (all homemade), pizzas, and sandwiches. The pasta has more flavor than you can imagine and it takes your taste-buds straight to Italy. I recently had the caprese sandwich and the mozzarella was perfect - very fresh!  The staff is also very friendly and the atmosphere is as casual as it gets. Show up in a dress, or in yoga pants.. no one cares.    I've never had a bad experience here and don't think I ever will.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Caprese sandwhich

zZN-qQaLirC4it9UyKFijw.text: Man do I love this place. They have my favorite sandwiches in the city - the Caprese is the standard for me but the new Royal is I think the best sandwich I have ever tasted. They toast the bread on the sides making it crisp and warm and the mixture of the meats, cheeses, and sauces are just delicioso. Mama mia.  I also love the outdoor seating area, as well as the beer selection (both cans and 5 on draft) and the kombucha and cold brew on tap. But the best part is how the deli area feels like a New Jersey deli I grew up with, with homemade sauces and soups, as well as meats and pastas and breads you can grab to try your hand at making food as good as P&P's and failing. Excellente. Thank you.

VT7J5fyuu8vtVKHir1f6iQ.text: This place has great food and super friendly staff. This is not what this review is about.  I came on a Thursday around 6:15. I parked in the parking lot as I planned to eat here. My husband was at Brawleys and I was going towards the patio to get him. A woman on a bike who I learned from the staff was the owners wife, went off on me about how I shouldn't park there. She was very rude to me and i was really upset about it. I probably won't be back. I understand the parking issues but you might want to be more careful about telling off your customers.

-4RPKByvajYGnFdu027vYA.text: I loved Pasta & Provisions from the first time I visited them at there other location but NOW I really love them in their second location!!! They have arrived in Madison Park and that is exactly where I live!  I've been to this location three time but failed write a review.  Me, hubs, and the poo-dell (my dog Valentino who is a poodle..hahaha) walked from our house to Pasta & Provisions.  The goal was to order food there and then walk it across the street to Brawley's.  Score.  I ordered a sandwich and a shrimp Kale salad and both were great!! What's really cool is that I ordered a glass of wine to sip on while I waited for my food.  There is an area where they open this garage door and there is a high top area that has bar stools which is awesome.    Now that it's nice weather and their patio area is open, it's so great!  Go and grab a beer or a glass of wine and order food and sit out back, or take the food to go and walk across to Brawley's.  Such a win win for both of them....but not much of a win win for my waistline.  Who cares...hahaha totally worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States

ivre8R04mR2B6UiNzs0vfw.text: Pasta and Provisions is a gem of a place located on Park Road next to Brawleys Beverage.  They specialize in homemade pastas and sauces. Inside, you will find a counter where you can order pastas, salads, sandwiches made to order. In the back is a large selection of wines, frozen pastas made in house, frozen Italian meals (lasagna, soups, etc) made in house, desserts, dips, etc. Essentially everything you would want to throw a party or a nice night in!  Most recently, my husband and I came here Saturday to get some food to go for our date with our couch and Netflix. We settled on the mushroom ravioli with maranara sauce, add meatballs, one of the salads (side note: There salads are Huuuuuge and definitely for sharing), and a thing of Queens Charlotte bacon and pimento cheese with crackers. Excellent foodie night. Everything was delish. I loved the meatballs!  They have a decent size patio in the back if you want to take your food outside to eat (not a ton of seating inside)  Excellent staple to the Park Road area!

5nN0CIcr5WjfRo_OWEdzgQ.text: Welcome to the Madison Park neighborhood...or what will soon be known to everyone in Charlotte as Montford Park. Directly off of Park Rd across from Brawley's (complementary combo).   It's a great new addition. It's a deli and small market with fresh pasta, sauces, wine, and items to fill your Italian pantry. Their other location on Providence makes the fresh pasta. If you want a quick sandwich (that is good portion) or a kale salad for lunch, they have that with a side bag of chips and a bottled beverage.   There are two bar tables with maybe 7 or 8 stools facing Park Road so you can watch the cars passing by while munching on a made to order sandwich. It looks like they are making a side outdoor patio. Maybe 10 parking spots; perfect to drop in, grab and go.   If you're in the neighborhood, pick up something for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deli menu
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States

yJtPROqO3jJACAt5f39Cng.text: Their homemade pasta is great! There's a 3-4 step process when ordering. First you choose your pasta flavor, I like rosemary garlic. Second, choose your pasta style like linguini, spaghetti, or fettuccine. Third choose your sauce, they have Alfredo, Pomodoro and marinara. Then fourth, you can add meat! Bon appetit!  When the weather is nice they open the big garage doors and you can sit at the bar. They have a small outdoor patio where you can brings dogs and sit at a round table that has a tree planted in the middle

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cute round table with a tree in the middle can make for the perfect setting to have a nice conversation
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Philly cheese steak, and pasta on a gorgeous spring day

rxtNIjCJyonyxOR7g6O95Q.text: Maybe it's an off day but I don't see what the buzz is about... If I ever want dry hard noodles I'll keep this place in mind.

wXo5oAruIHJm0Ygzswyc9w.text: We stopped in to check out this market that offers deli meats, fresh pasta, sauces, and dough for pizza. It's a small lot with a few spaces - no hassle finding parking if you go in the early afternoon before dinner.   They have a small selection of pantry items like olive oils, crackers, and Italian things on the left side of the shop. They sell their own pizza dough, Italian soups, sauces, and desserts in the refrigerated area.   If it is your first visit with them, they give you 3/4 lb of fresh pasta in the flavor and pasta style of your choice, free of charge. The staff will recommend flavors based on what sauce or dish you plan to make with their pasta.   3/4 lb was plenty to feed 2 people and it was tasty. We went back for their egg pasta when we wanted to make spaghetti and meatballs.

zGVxEkFkZYGtabu5sx_lfQ.text: This place was very quaint. It kind of came off as an exclusive club that people weren't quite sure they were willing to accept you in. None the less, i proceeded on the adventure on checking what this place was about. The outdoor patio was the perfect setting for the sunny relaxing afternoon.   I gave four stars because of this reason, I felt like my questioning of the menu was an irritant to the staff. When I ordered my pesto chicken and mushroom garlic linguine and cheesy garlic bread it would have been helpful to tell me I'm supposed to just pick up my order instead of waiting to hand my pager off. I even had to ask them what I was supposed to do all the while looking like the lost lamb waiting for the attention of an employee.   The food was delicious though! I loved the pesto and the fresh noodles. The cheesy garlic bread was the perfect addition to my noodle dish but was also amazing by itself. I happened to pass someone and saw that they had tiramisu so I picked some of that up too. After letting it thaw at home, I knew that I would definitely be returning to grab some more!   Overall, this place is nice if you are in the mood for pasta. Even though a little intimidating and not the most helpful staff, I will definitely still go back to enjoy the ambiance of the back patio and drink some wine until my tiramisu is soft enough to devour!

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States

6ikfINiLoRAvEjIa6U9mqQ.text: This place is awesome. As far as I know, the original fresh pasta place in Charlotte to take and go. Great chicken parm to go, as well as wines, cheeses, etc. it reminds me of places I love in NYC. Carries a small selection of wine, so it can be a one stop dinner shop. Very uncharacteristically cool for the old CLT.   Looks like they sell sandwiches and basic deli stuff now as well. Wish I'd known that sooner.

ghobp9G4ADjnWgQWtbZH9w.text: Cool honeycomb hideout sandwich and more spot in Charlotte . I was greeted as soon as I walked in the door someone behind the counter helped me decide on one of the best selling sandwiches they had to offer I couldn't have made a better choice. All ingredients were fresh . The patio in the back was super cute and gave me rustic artsy vibes . Back patio was perfect for sipping wine I didn't indulge this time around but I'll give them another spin .

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sandwiches and art on the back patio

lUjY2wEgh7VYJqNhdI3q_A.text: Highly disappointed...ordered the Caprese sandwich.  I swear it took 15 minutes to make and then when I got it, the roll was burnt and doused in balsamic glaze. very little basil and not worth a charge of $8.

pr_QB8QUy1Of0fZMQaIK7A.text: This place is known for pasta, but it's one of my go-to spots for sandwiches. Favorites are the meatball sub and the caprese. The basil pesto is amazing. The staff are always friendly. There's kombucha and cold brew on draft. Charlotte weather is hit or miss, but there is an adorable patio in the back with string lanterns.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States

HxNZX9oVUVFXMFodGbdNCg.text: Came for the first time to actually eat here today. We Have taken pasta home with us before to cook but never actually dined in the shop.  Pretty straight forward- small selection of pastas, sandwiches,pizza and salad. Order at the counter to the right on walking in. They give you a buzzer and you pick your food up at the counter. They have a few indoor seats at the bar and a larger patio area outside. We ordered the garlic rosemary linguini with basil pesto and chicken, a pepperoni pizza and cheesy garlic bread. It was all really good. The pasta is fresh and I like how they cook the chicken. The cheesy garlic bread is delish and comes with a marinara dipping sauce. I like that the pizza is a very thin crust.  I love all their takeaway options. We like grabbing their bolognese sauce and some hand cut pasta to take home with us. They have great tiramisu too.

guLXY5j4Yi9XD5gPzUSYlA.text: This was my first time here but I have heard many great things about this place so I wanted to check it out. This place has bottle wine for sale, pasta and frozen ready-to-bake pasta meals that you can take home and put in the oven for dinner. They also have food that you can order and eat there.   We came for lunch and we split an Italian sandwich and kale salad. First the portions are very generous and the prices very reasonable for the quality of the food. The sandwich and the salad were about $7-$8 each.   Second, the salad was very unique and the vegetables tasted very fresh. I am not a big fan of kale but between the light and flavorful dressing and the colorful and tasty assortment of vegetables it made this salad so good! The Italian sandwich was also wonderful. The bread was soft and fresh tasting and included aged prosciutto not just salami  and pepperoni like you get at other restaurants with Italian sandwiches.   This place is small and does not really have much seating on the inside but they have a great garden-like patio outside with plenty of seating there. This place reminds me of a restaurant/provisions store I went to in Italy last summer. It is quaint and the staff was very friendly and very helpful when we were trying to decide what to order.   This place is a great lunch spot but I would also come here for a casual, low-key dinner. They also have a fridge with local craft beers. I definitely plan on coming back, this time ordering what they are known for: pasta!

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Italian sandwich
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kale salad

RarqbTCb3tfu_dUj9mxFqg.text: One of the best place to visit for fresh pasta in Charlotte. You pick the type of pasta (spaghetti, linguini, etc), the variety of pasta flavor (lemon pepper, spinach, etc), the protein (meatballs, chicken, shrimp) and the sauce (carbonara, pesto basil, Pomodoro) to create your own pasta. I especially love their pesto basil sauce with linguini lemon pepper.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States

z2vN9UKN-m-bqxKFSoQgYg.text: I'll get right to the point. When I saw the reviews and the menu for pasta and provisions, I had fairly high expectations. Those expectations were not met. We ordered ravioli and fettuccine, both were under sauced and dry. They actually sucked moisture out of your mouth.There were only a couple of other customers in the place when we went, so the problem cannot be blamed on a high lunch volume. For a restaurant that specializes in pasta, I found our visit to be very disappointing, and don't see much reason for a return trip.

wmXKg-Lq7mJYTscZGMkklw.text: This is a hidden gem for lunch near Montford area...  My colleagues and I come here at least once a week.  I like most of their pasta and sandwich but the Cob salad is da bom!!! (See pics)  Or you can add a side salad with any sandwich or pasta bowl...  The price is very affordable and good portion...it fills you up but doesn't put you to sleep at 2pm in your cubicle...  I totally recommend this place to my peepz!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Italian sandwich w/ side cob salad
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cob Salad w chicken (can be switch out with shrimp)

moHkhbx7cT-8OSbtFsWiSg.text: I'm VERY sad to say that I found this place to be INSANELY overrated.   Pasta options were limited - 8 max to choose from. They don't have chicken options for the pasta at all. When we got our pasta dishes, I had to add salt to mine as I found it lacking flavor. The pasta itself was a little hard as well which was a disappointment.  The wine list was good, but everything was just so pricey! Ordered Riesling for $42/bottle and then got charged $58/bottle on the receipt. Brought it up to the server and he seemed annoyed that we noticed.   The kitchen is open so if you sit at the bar stools you can see the chefs cook. Cool concept, but man do they need to turn up the AC. It got HOT in there to the point that I was sweating while eating. How enjoyable.

nBREzJRQHXIm8SyEi1spcA.text: Good food, nice employees, everything was fresh and legit. I would recommend anyone in the area to try them out. The cheese steak sandwich was my favorite.

CS8M2LnCN95pijCkAJtYZQ.text: This is the best pasta I've had outside of Italy. They are incredibly helpful in assisting you in picking out your pasta and are very friendly.   We got the pesto sauce with lemon pepper noodles and the pomodoro sauce with garlic rosemary noodles. We also got the french dip sandwich. Everything was incredibly delicious. We got the stuffed cookies for dessert and I also tried the Updog apple pie kambucha which were all great.   You get your food fast and can either way there at the bar or on the heated patio outside it get it to go.   We will definitely be coming back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stuffed cookies!
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. French dip
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pomodoro with garlic rosemary noodles

HGFxJX7ypG1zuxyoG-l9-Q.text: This place is such a gem. I recently moved in nearby and can walk here from my apartment, which is a huge win. They have great sandwiches, fresh pastas, and wine--so really, everything you could ever possibly need. They're also open past dinner time during the week, which is really convenient if I didn't get the chance to buy something to cook.  I've had their caprese sandwich a couple of times and it's great. They toast the bread with the balsamic on it so it makes a little bit of a crust, which is delicious with the heaps of tomato and mozz. I've also had the turkey sandwich, which is also tasty. The bacon jam on it is wonderful and the avocado makes it all very creamy. My husband and I have also grabbed a couple of hot pastas to go. We tried the rosemary linguine with pomodoro & meatballs and a linguine with alfredo sauce. The portions are generous and come with a small roll, and the pasta was cooked perfectly. We were big fans of the meatballs, too. My husband comes from an Italian family and these are pretty great.   One time we grabbed one of their massive tiramisus to go to have at home, and for I think around $8 this thing is huge. It's perfection. And it didn't last in our fridge more than a day. Whoops. They have a great little wine area, too, with tons of great Italian wines and some discount bottles. There's still so many things I haven't tried like the raviolis and pizzas, but I can't wait to come back to try more.

nsPgKZYWsHZmPSALhYZrYw.text: I have to admit that the name Pasta and Provisions doesn't sound very appetizing. I've driven by here many times thinking it was some sort of grocery store that only sold pasta. Well boy am I glad I was wrong. This place has some delicious sandwiches and drinks.   I got the Italian sandwich. I am told it is the must have choice here. My wife got the pork belly sandwich which had a fried egg on it.  They also have a great patio out back that lets you kick your Uggs up and enjoy the outside air. The staff was friendly AF and really showed us the ropes on how to order. They have these delicious chips from New Orleans that I've never tried before as well.  I sat with my wife drinking kombucha in the fall air and thinking about the future. The crisp breeze was just cold enough to make me wish I had worn a jacket but not cold enough to make me go inside. I thought about how good life has been to me in the past year. And I am so thankful. And much like the leaves changing colors on the trees I too am ready to go with the flow of the next phase of my life. Whatever that may be.   We are all connected. Yes, even the two dudes in suits who chose to sit at the big round table we were already sitting at. Like it's totally cool ya'll didn't even ask or anything. That's fine. Like I said we're all in this together.  The food at Pasta and Provisions is so good and the atmosphere is so cozy. This place is like Uggs for your soul.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ah lunch time. Such a nice fall day. #PumpkinSpiceUpYourLife

ci1FvHBFsWTXtbtKKGUDYQ.text: This location has it all! My daughters favorite sandwich , Turkey Sub, mine, Meatballl Sub. Pasta, sauces and prepared dishes.

KT1qVODpDyRtmeCkhRjyRQ.text: I like the idea of this place!  A specific type of food that you can take-away!  It's Italian here and lot's of pasta, sauces and etc for you to drool over.    Look up the history of this place because it's pretty cool and family-owned still.  We've gotten them a couple of times now and really like the portion sizes for two people.  We usually get 2 different pastas and 2 different sauces and share them between us.  The pancetta & cartelized ravioli is really good with the pesto sauce or the bolognese.  It's fun to hang out across the street at Brawley's for a beer or two before we pick up our food and head home.

XtIMlwX8JQ7mPrNus54XTg.text: I got the whole wheat linguine Alfredo with veggies after a 3 mile run on Thursday.  It was really delicious but it wasn't the first time I've been here.  My favorite dish here is the whole wheat fettuccine basil pesto with shrimp.  This place is nice and quaint and the outside patio is filled with nice scenery.  I whole heartedly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pasta & Provisions - Charlotte, NC, United States

buMRgdoeB73lx-v-bmnOPw.text: They were so kind at this store. They treated me like family, the type of service you don't forget. Not to mention the food was authentic and fresh
